page.title: 11Farming in the Coxheath area
page.content:
There are many farming activities in the area (see also page 13).
{Nursery -}The Mid-Kent Garden Service} is a small nursery. Trees, shrubs, potted and garden plants are grown. Some plants are sold for use in show houses and for exhibition stands at the Kent County Show.
{Coppice -}Sweet Chestnut trees are grown for coppicing. The trees grow for about fourteen years. They are then cut for poles and fencing.
{Rabbits -}Rabbits are reared in a large shed at West Farleigh. There are about fifty New Zealand white does each producing about 45 young per year. The meat is sold to supermarkets and the fur used for hats etc.
